content:
Anjie Le majored in mathematics at the University of Cambridge. Her work mainly focuses on applying mathematics to the biomedical world. She has done two projects on breast cancer and one on canine CT scans; two on ultrasound imaging, one on CT and one on Whole Slide Images.
As a person, Anjie has a broad spectrum of interests. Quantum computing and Langlands program are something she was keen on. Philosophy, psychology, economics and criminology are what she enjoys reading about in her spare time. Snowboarding, land surfing, swimming, horse-riding and Taekwondo are what she may do when she wants to exercise. She plays the piano and guitar. She enjoys visiting different places. She has three cats.
summary:
Anjie Le majored in mathematics at the University of Cambridge. Her work mainly focuses on applying mathematics to the biomedical world. She has done two projects on breast cancer and one on canine CT scans; two on ultrasound imaging, one on CT and one on Whole Slide Images.
As a person, Anjie has a broad spectrum of interests. Quantum computing and Langlands program are something she was keen on. Philosophy, psychology, economics and criminology are what she enjoys reading about in her spare time.
title: Anjie Le

content:
Former CTO of Philips Healthcare, founder of Supersonic, Sonosite and so on.
I was honoured to directly report to Acad Jacques Souquet during my time at E-Sonic Imaging, where he is the Chairman and co-founder. During that time, he shared a lot with me about his vision for the future of medical imaging and population health. He is an important mentor of mine, and has definitely shaped my career goal.
We co-wrote the patent ‘Artificial Intelligence Integrated Diagnostic Platform Device in Ultrasound Modality’, together with a colleague of ours.
He kindly wrote a letter of recommendation for me and authorized its unrestricted use.
summary:
Former CTO of Philips Healthcare, founder of Supersonic, Sonosite and so on.
I was honoured to directly report to Acad Jacques Souquet during my time at E-Sonic Imaging, where he is the Chairman and co-founder. During that time, he shared a lot with me about his vision for the future of medical imaging and population health. He is an important mentor of mine, and has definitely shaped my career goal.
title: Jacques Souquet

content: We co-wrote the paper “A new breast cancer diagnosis application based on ResNet50”.
summary: We co-wrote the paper “A new breast cancer diagnosis application based on ResNet50”.
title: Haobo Yang

content:
Dr Chris Warner was my Director of Studies at the University of Cambridge, as well as supervisors in Vector and Matrices, Differential Equation, Dynamic and Relativity, Electromagnetism, and so on.
In addition to his academic guidance, Dr Warner was also in charge of my well-being at Cambridge, and his support enabled me to make the most of my studies in the Mathematics Tripos. I am grateful for his mentorship and guidance, which played a significant role in my academic and personal development.
summary:
Dr Chris Warner was my Director of Studies at the University of Cambridge, as well as supervisors in Vector and Matrices, Differential Equation, Dynamic and Relativity, Electromagnetism, and so on.
In addition to his academic guidance, Dr Warner was also in charge of my well-being at Cambridge, and his support enabled me to make the most of my studies in the Mathematics Tripos. I am grateful for his mentorship and guidance, which played a significant role in my academic and personal development.
title: Chris Warner

content:
In Lemma 9 $$(1-2\mu\eta_r)^{(K-1)/2}=(1-\frac{2\gamma_r}{R(K-1)})^{(K-1)/2}\leq 1-\gamma_r/R$$ only holds for $K\leq 3$. Otherwise, LHS $\geq$ RHS rather than $\leq$.
In Lemma 14 For $\tau_3$, haven’t found a clear reason to support why it is $c-c_i+\nabla f_i(x)$ rather than $c-c_i-\nabla f_i(x)$. If this is a typo, then the proof for $\tau_3$ doesn’t work. In the line of equation below (25), have an extra $\beta$ in the term $7\beta\eta_l^2\sigma^2$, so that in the final result, the coefficient of $\sigma^2$ is missing by a factor of $63\tilde{\eta}^2$.
title: Errors in the proof of convergence of SCAFFOLD

summary: 一种超声模态的人工智能一体化诊断平台设备
title: Artificial Intelligence Integrated Diagnostic Platform Device in Ultrasound Modality
